00002 #include <cstddef>

00009 namespace Sass {
00010   using namespace Constants;
00011 
00012   namespace Prelexer {
00013 
00014     //####################################
00015     // BASIC CHARACTER MATCHERS
00016     //####################################
00017 
00018     // Match standard control chars
00019     const char* kwd_at(const char* src) { return exactly<'@'>(src); }
00020     const char* kwd_dot(const char* src) { return exactly<'.'>(src); }
00021     const char* kwd_comma(const char* src) { return exactly<','>(src); };
00022     const char* kwd_colon(const char* src) { return exactly<':'>(src); };
00023     const char* kwd_star(const char* src) { return exactly<'*'>(src); };
00024     const char* kwd_plus(const char* src) { return exactly<'+'>(src); };
00025     const char* kwd_minus(const char* src) { return exactly<'-'>(src); };
00026     const char* kwd_slash(const char* src) { return exactly<'/'>(src); };
00027 
00028     //####################################
00029     // implement some function that do exist in the standard
00030     // but those are locale aware which brought some trouble
00031     // this even seems to improve performance by quite a bit
00032     //####################################
00033 
00034     bool is_alpha(const char& chr)
00035     {
00036       return unsigned(chr - 'A') <= 'Z' - 'A' ||
00037              unsigned(chr - 'a') <= 'z' - 'a';
00038     }
00039 
00040     bool is_space(const char& chr)
00041     {
00042       // adapted the technique from is_alpha
00043       return chr == ' ' || unsigned(chr - '\t') <= '\r' - '\t';
00044     }
00045 
00046     bool is_digit(const char& chr)
00047     {
00048       // adapted the technique from is_alpha
00049       return unsigned(chr - '0') <= '9' - '0';
00050     }
00051 
00052     bool is_xdigit(const char& chr)
00053     {
00054       // adapted the technique from is_alpha
00055       return unsigned(chr - '0') <= '9' - '0' ||
00056              unsigned(chr - 'a') <= 'f' - 'a' ||
00057              unsigned(chr - 'A') <= 'F' - 'A';
00058     }
00059 
00060     bool is_punct(const char& chr)
00061     {
00062       // locale independent
00063       return chr == '.';
00064     }
00065 
00066     bool is_alnum(const char& chr)
00067     {
00068       return is_alpha(chr) || is_digit(chr);
00069     }
00070 
00071     // check if char is outside ascii range
00072     bool is_unicode(const char& chr)
00073     {
00074       // check for unicode range
00075       return unsigned(chr) > 127;
00076     }
00077 
00078     // Match word character (look ahead)
00079     bool is_character(const char& chr)
00080     {
00081       // valid alpha, numeric or unicode char (plus hyphen)
00082       return is_alnum(chr) || is_unicode(chr) || chr == '-';
00083     }
00084 
00085     //####################################
00086     // BASIC CLASS MATCHERS
00087     //####################################
00088 
00089     // create matchers that advance the position
00090     const char* space(const char* src) { return is_space(*src) ? src + 1 : 0; }
00091     const char* alpha(const char* src) { return is_alpha(*src) ? src + 1 : 0; }
00092     const char* unicode(const char* src) { return is_unicode(*src) ? src + 1 : 0; }
00093     const char* digit(const char* src) { return is_digit(*src) ? src + 1 : 0; }
00094     const char* xdigit(const char* src) { return is_xdigit(*src) ? src + 1 : 0; }
00095     const char* alnum(const char* src) { return is_alnum(*src) ? src + 1 : 0; }
00096     const char* punct(const char* src) { return is_punct(*src) ? src + 1 : 0; }
00097     const char* character(const char* src) { return is_character(*src) ? src + 1 : 0; }
00098 
00099     // Match multiple ctype characters.
00100     const char* spaces(const char* src) { return one_plus<space>(src); }
00101     const char* digits(const char* src) { return one_plus<digit>(src); }
00102 
00103     // Whitespace handling.
00104     const char* no_spaces(const char* src) { return negate< space >(src); }
00105     const char* optional_spaces(const char* src) { return zero_plus< space >(src); }
00106 
00107     // Match any single character.
00108     const char* any_char(const char* src) { return *src ? src + 1 : src; }
00109 
00110     // Match word boundary (zero-width lookahead).
00111     const char* word_boundary(const char* src) { return is_character(*src) ? 0 : src; }
00112 
00113     // Match linefeed /(?:\n|\r\n?)/
00114     const char* re_linebreak(const char* src)
00115     {
00116       // end of file or unix linefeed return here
00117       if (*src == 0 || *src == '\n') return src + 1;
00118       // a carriage return may optionally be followed by a linefeed
00119       if (*src == '\r') return *(src + 1) == '\n' ? src + 2 : src + 1;
00120       // no linefeed
00121       return 0;
00122     }
00123 
00124     // Assert string boundaries (/\Z|\z|\A/)
00125     // This is a zero-width positive lookahead
00126     const char* end_of_line(const char* src)
00127     {
00128       // end of file or unix linefeed return here
00129       return *src == 0 || *src == '\n' || *src == '\r' ? src : 0;
00130     }
00131 
00132   }
00133 }
